title: Blackcube alpha sign
content:
I need to know what font is used for the alpha symbol, anybody any idea?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Blackcube Trademark.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824115911/http:/typophile.com/files/Blackcube%20Trademark.jpg) | 29.29 KB |
author: OctopusC

comments.content:
Hello,

Font is [Modern Twenty CG (Regular) by Agfa](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824115911/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Modern%20Twenty/fonts/)

Symbol alpha is manually inserted in this graphic; I have a believe it is hand-written alpha.  
Might be someone else is able to help you with alpha.

Thanks  
Regards,  
Hasnain

Yeah, I have the Modern 20 ok, thanks.

Gonna have to just rely on illustrators trace tool and fix it up.

Thanks  
Hasnain

Alpha seems from Lucida Math I.  
Not sure of this link:  
 [http://www.fontage.com/pages/lmath2.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824115911/http:/www.fontage.com/pages/lmath2.html "http://www.fontage.com/pages/lmath2.html")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140824115911im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alpha_5195.jpg)
